Interface Iogr::IOGRManager

Interface Iogr::IOGRManager

interface IOGRManager
This interface defines methods of IOGRManager. It allows to create and manipulate IOGR (Interoperable Object Group Reference), FTCORBA compliant, with TAG_FT_GROUP and eventually TAG_FT_PRIMARY.

Available Since:
JDK 1.2
Version:
1.0

Operation Index

add_Member
Add the specified Object to the specified ObjecGroup.
create_IOGR
Create an IOGR, FTCORBA compliant, containing the Objects of the specified ObjectList with specified TAG_FT_GROUP.
extract_Object
Returns a Vector of the Objects contained in the specified ObjectGroup.
get_Group_Version
Returns Group Version of the specified ObjectGroup.
get_Primary_Member
Returns the primary member of the specified Objectgroup, if it is set; otherwise, returns an IOGRException.
is_Equivalent
Tests if two Objects are equivalent.
is_ObjectGroup
Tests if the specified Object is an ObjectGroup, with TAG_FT_GROUP FTCORBA compliant.
remove_Member
Remove the specified Object from the specified ObjectGroup, if it is found; otherwise returns an IOGRException.
set_Group_Version
Set as ObjectGroupVersion of the specified ObjectGroup the value passed as parameter.
set_Primary_Member
Set as Primary Member of the specified ObjectGroup the Object passed as parameter, if it is in ObjectGroup; otherwise, returns an IOGRException.

Operations

add_Member
ObjectGroup add_Member(in ObjectGroup object_group,
                       in Object obj)
    raises(IOGRException);

Add the specified Object to the specified ObjecGroup. If the specified Object is found in ObjectGroup or the type_id is wrong, returns an IOGRException.

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup into which the Object is to be added.
obj_ior - Object is to be added in the specified ObjectGroup. @returns ObjectReference of ObjectGroup with new member.
Raises:
IOGRException - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found - Wrong Type Id - No Profiles in IOGR - No Profiles in IOR - Wrong IOR - Duplicate Member.

create_IOGR
ObjectGroup create_IOGR(in org::omg::CORBA::FT::FTDomainId ft_domain_id,
                        in org::omg::CORBA::FT::ObjectGroupId obiect_group_id,
                        in org::omg::CORBA::FT::ObjectGroupRefVersion object_group_ref_version,
                        in ObjectList obj_list)
    raises(IOGRException);

Create an IOGR, FTCORBA compliant, containing the Objects of the specified ObjectList with specified TAG_FT_GROUP. If ObjectList is empty, create an IOGR with MultipleComponentProfile, which must be used to represent ObjectGroup without members.

Parameters:
ft_domain_id - Domain identifier.
object_group_id - ObjectGroup identifier.
object_group_ref_version - ObjectGroup version.
obj_list - ObjectList contains objects to add in IOGR.
Returns:
ObjectGroupReference.

extract_Object
ObjectList extract_Object(in ObjectGroup object_group)
    raises(IOGRException);

Returns a Vector of the Objects contained in the specified ObjectGroup. If the ObjectGroup is empty or contains only a MultipleComponentProfile, returns an IOGRException.

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup containing profiles to extract.
Returns:
A Vector of Objects contained in ObjectGroup passed as parameter.
Raises:
IOGRException - No Profiles in IOGR - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found

get_Group_Version
org::omg::CORBA::FT::ObjectGroupRefVersion get_Group_Version(in ObjectGroup object_group)
    raises(IOGRException);

Returns Group Version of the specified ObjectGroup. If the ObjectGroup is empty, returns an IOGRException

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup into which the version is to be searched
Returns:
ObjectGroupRefVersion of ObjectGroup
Raises:
IOGRException - No Profiles in IOGR - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found.

get_Primary_Member
Object get_Primary_Member(in ObjectGroup object_group)
    raises(IOGRException);

Returns the primary member of the specified Objectgroup, if it is set; otherwise, returns an IOGRException.

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup into which the primary is to be searched.
Returns:
Primary ObjectReference
Raises:
IOGRException - Primary Not Found - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found - No Profiles in IOGR.

is_Equivalent
boolean is_Equivalent(in Object object_a,
                      in Object object_b)
    raises(IOGRException);

Tests if two Objects are equivalent. According to FTCORBA spec there are three cases to consider for checking equivalence:

  • 1. Two non-object group references.In this case, the semantics of the operation are unchanged.
  • 2. An object group reference and a non-object group reference. These references are not equivalent.
  • 3. Two object group references. In this case, they are equivalent if they have the same ft_domain_id and the same object_group_id fields.

Parameters:
obj_a - First Object to test for equivalence.
obj_b - Second Object to test for equivalence.
Returns:
true, if the ObjectGroupReference are equivalent; false, otherwise.
Raises:
IOGRException - No Profiles in IOGR.

is_ObjectGroup
boolean is_ObjectGroup(in Object object_group)
    raises(IOGRException);

Tests if the specified Object is an ObjectGroup, with TAG_FT_GROUP FTCORBA compliant.

Parameters:
obj - The Object is to be tested.
Returns:
true, if the specified Object contains the TAG_FT_GROUP; false, otherwise.
Raises:
IOGRException - No Profiles in IOGR

remove_Member
ObjectGroup remove_Member(in ObjectGroup object_group,
                          in Object obj)
    raises(IOGRException);

Remove the specified Object from the specified ObjectGroup, if it is found; otherwise returns an IOGRException.

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup into which the Object is to be removed.
obj_ior - Object is to be removed.
Returns:
ObjectReference of ObjectGroup with the specified Object removed.
Raises:
IOGRException - Object Not Found in Object Group - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found - No Profiles in IOGR - Wrong Type Id - No Profiles in IOR - Wrong IOR.

set_Group_Version
ObjectGroup set_Group_Version(in ObjectGroup object_group,
                              in org::omg::CORBA::FT::ObjectGroupRefVersion version)
    raises(IOGRException);

Set as ObjectGroupVersion of the specified ObjectGroup the value passed as parameter.

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup into which the version is to be set.
obj_ior - Version number.
Returns:
ObjectReference of ObjectGroup with new ObjectGroupVersion.
Raises:
IOGRException - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found - No Profiles in IOGR.

set_Primary_Member
ObjectGroup set_Primary_Member(in ObjectGroup object_group,
                               in Object primary_object)
    raises(IOGRException);

Set as Primary Member of the specified ObjectGroup the Object passed as parameter, if it is in ObjectGroup; otherwise, returns an IOGRException. If a previous Primary Member is found, it is removed from ObjectGroup.

Parameters:
obj_iogr - ObjectGroup into which the primary is to be set.
obj_ior - Object is to be set as primary.
Returns:
ObjectReference of ObjectGroup with new Primary
Raises:
IOGRException - Object Not Found in Object Group - TAG_FT_GROUP Not Found - No Profiles in IOGR - Wrong Type Id - No Profiles in IOR - Wrong IOR.
